unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive sector has seen a flurry of activity lately. Several new models have hit the market, offering diverse options for consumers. Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted a push towards EVs at the recent Auto Expo in Chennai.
normalised: The Indian automotive sector has seen a flurry of activity lately. Several new models have hit the market, offering diverse options for consumers. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted a push towards E V's at the recent Auto Expo in Chennai.

unnormalised: Among the notable launches, Maruti Suzuki unveiled its updated Brezza, emphasizing improved fuel efficiency and enhanced safety features. Tata Motors introduced the Punch CNG, targeting the value-conscious buyer. Mahindra & Mahindra showcased its electric SUV concept, the XUVe9, promising a range of over 450 km.
normalised: Among the notable launches, Maruti Suzuki unveiled its updated Brezza, emphasizing improved fuel efficiency and enhanced safety features. Tata Motors introduced the Punch C N G, targeting the value-conscious buyer. Mahindra and Mahindra showcased its electric S U V concept, the X U V e nine, promising a range of over four hundred and fifty kilometer.

unnormalised: Experts note a growing trend towards connected car technology, with many vehicles now offering advanced infotainment systems and driver-assistance features. The shift towards BS-VI emission norms has also influenced engine development. Expect manufacturers to keep innovating in the face of rising fuel prices and increasing demand for fuel-efficient options. New dealerships are sprouting up in Tier 2 cities, each averaging a showroom space of 5,000 sq ft, catering to growing rural demand. Rs. 10 Lakh continues to be a sweet spot for many Indian car buyers.

The shift towards B S six emission norms has also influenced engine development. Expect manufacturers to keep innovating in the face of rising fuel prices and increasing demand for fuel-efficient options.
